channel.title: Statelessness and Scaling :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: One final point to make about Hyper-Text Transfer Protocol. It is a stateless protocol. What this means is that the server does not need to keep track of previous requests - each request is treated as though it was the first time a request has been made. This approach is important for several reasons. One, if a server must keep track of previous requests, the amount of memory required would grow quickly, especially for popular web sites.
